template <dimension_type dim0 = 0, dimension_type dim1 = 1, dimension_type dim2 = 2>
class vsip::tuple
File: ../../../vsip/support.hpp

Class to define dimension ordering for Dense blocks.

The template parameters to tuple specify the order in which logical dimensions are used to address memory, starting from major-dimension to minor-dimension. For a contiguous data-layout, elements in the minor-dimension are unit-stride.

Logical dimensions are numbered from left-to-right, starting with zero.

For a tensor 'ten' element reference 'ten(x, y, z)', 'x' is the 0th dimension, 'y' is the 1st dimension, and 'z' is the 2nd dimension.

For a Matrix 'mat' element reference 'mat(r, c)', 'r' is the 0th dimension (also the row) and 'c' is the 1st dimension (also the column).

-Public Data members
const dimension_type impl_dim0 = dim0
const dimension_type impl_dim1 = dim1
const dimension_type impl_dim2 = dim2
